metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9493 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The V2 API in OpenStack Image Registry and Delivery Service (Glance) before 2014.2.2 and 2014.1.4 allows remote authenticated users to read or delete arbitrary files via a full pathname in a file: URL in the image location property.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glance - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
glance-api - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
glance-common - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
glance-registry - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
python-glance - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> Per upstream, "A potential mitigation strategy available for operators is to change the glance policy to restrict access to administrators for get_image_location, set_image_location, and delete_image_location." Ubuntu 12.04 LTS not affected (does not have V2 API) preliminary packages for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and 14.10 can be found in: https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-security-proposed/+archive/ubuntu/ppa/+packages mdeslaur> This issue wasn't fully addressed by the original patches, see: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-announce/2015-January/000323.html incomplete fix got CVE-2015-1195

criterions.comment: glance package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1').
